turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Effects of Hurricane Isabel in North Carolina.
turn.1: Where did Hurricane Isabel affect people?
turn.2: Most near the Pamlico Sound remained in their own neighborhood or own county.
turn.3: Did some people leave the area?
turn.4: Of the 19 North Carolina counties issuing evacuation orders, the duration of the evacuation process varied between 3 hours to 12 hours in Dare County.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Five counties reported heavy amounts of traffic, while traffic problems included stalled cars along roads, inadequate route signing, and flooded or damaged roads.
turn.8: By the morning of the hurricane's landfall, 65 shelters were prepared with a capacity of 95,000 people.
turn.10: The American Red Cross prepared 100 feeding vehicles in staging areas, and deployed two mobile kitchens each with the capacity to provide 10,000 meals per day.
turn.11: Were there other organizations on standby?
turn.12: Additionally, five Southern Baptist Convention kitchens were on standby, in total being able to provide 20,000 meals per day.
